name: Colocynthis
Relationship: Compare: LOBELIA ERINUS (violent cork-screw-like pains in abdomen). DIPODIUM PUNCTATUM (WRITHING. Twisting like a dying snake. Intractable insomnia.) DIOSCOR.; CHAMOM.; COCCUL.; MERC; PLUM.; MAG. PHOS.Antidote: COFFEA; STAPHIS.; CHAM. COLOCYNTH is the best antidote to lead poisoning. (Royal).

Eyes: Sensation on stooping, as if eye would fall out
Violent pain in eyeballs which precede the development of glaucoma
Stomach: Tongue rough, as from sand, and feels scalded
Feeling in stomach as if something would not yield; drawing pain
Head: Frontal headache; worse, stooping, lying on back, and moving eyelids
Lateral cutting headache, with nausea, vomiting
Pains , with soreness of scalp
Burning pains, digging, rending, and tearing
Vertigo when turning head to the left
Urine: Intense burning along urethra during stool
Red, hard crystals, adhering firmly to vessel
Vesical catarrh, discharge like fresh white of egg
Pains on urinating over whole abdomen
Fetid; small quantities, with frequent urging
Modalities: Better: lying with head bent forward
Abdomen: Cutting in abdomen, especially after anger
Agonizing cutting pain in abdomen causing patient to bend over double, and pressing on the abdomen
Sensation as if stones were being ground together in the abdomen, and would burst
Pain in small spot below navel
Dysenteric stool renewed each time by the least food or drink
Each paroxysm is attended with general agitation and a chill over the cheeks, ascending from the hypogastrium
Female: Must draw up double, with great restlessness
Round, small cystic tumors in ovaries or broad ligaments
Bearing-down cramps, causing her to bend double
Extremities: Cramp-like pain in hip; lies on affected side; pain from hip to knee
Pain down right thigh; muscles and tendons feel too short; numbness with pains
Sciatic pain, left side, drawing, tearing; better, pressure and heat; worse, gentle touch
Stiffness of joints and shortening of tendons
All the limbs are drawn together
Face: Tearing, shooting, and swelling of face; left side great soreness
Pain in stomach, always with pain of teeth or head
Neuralgia, with chilliness; teeth seem too long

details: Often indicated in the transition season when the air is cold, but the sun is still powerful enough to heat the blood. Develops most of its symptoms in the abdomen and head, causing intense neuralgias. It is especially suitable for irritable persons easily angered, and ill effects therefrom. Women with copious menstruation, and of sedentary habits. Persons with a tendency to corpulency. The neuralgic pains are nearly always relieved by pressure. Cramps and twitching and shortening of muscles. Constrictions and contractions. Cystospasm following operations on orifices. (HYPER.) Urinous odor or perspiration (BERB.; NIT-AC.) AGONIZING PAIN IN ABDOMEN, causing patient to bend double, is most characteristic. Sensations: Cutting, twisting, grinding, contracting and bruised; AS IF CLAMPED WITH IRON BANDS.
